description: Resource Type definition for EKS Capability.

Tag.description: A key-value pair to associate with a resource.

Key.description: The key name of the tag. You can specify a value that is 1 to 128 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.
Key.markdownDescription:
The key name of the tag. You can specify a value that is 1 to 128 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.

---

Required: Yes  
Type: String  
Minimum Length: 1  
Maximum Length: 128  
Update requires: No interruption

Value.description: The value for the tag. You can specify a value that is 0 to 256 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.
Value.markdownDescription:
The value for the tag. You can specify a value that is 0 to 256 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.

---

Required: Yes  
Type: String  
Maximum Length: 256  
Update requires: No interruption

Tag.markdownDescription:
A key-value pair to associate with a resource.

---

Required: No  
Update requires: No interruption

CapabilityConfiguration.description: Configuration settings for a capability. The structure of this object varies depending on the capability type.
CapabilityConfiguration.markdownDescription:
Configuration settings for a capability. The structure of this object varies depending on the capability type.

---

Required: No  
Update requires: Replacement
Read only property: Yes

ArgoCd.description: Configuration settings for an Argo CD capability. This includes the Kubernetes namespace, IAM Identity Center integration, RBAC role mappings, and network access configuration.

Namespace.description: The Kubernetes namespace where Argo CD resources will be created. If not specified, the default namespace is used.
Namespace.markdownDescription:
The Kubernetes namespace where Argo CD resources will be created. If not specified, the default namespace is used.

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Update requires: No interruption

RbacRoleMappings.description: A list of role mappings that define which IAM Identity Center users or groups have which Argo CD roles. Each mapping associates an Argo CD role (ADMIN, EDITOR, or VIEWER) with one or more IAM Identity Center identities.
RbacRoleMappings.markdownDescription:
A list of role mappings that define which IAM Identity Center users or groups have which Argo CD roles. Each mapping associates an Argo CD role (ADMIN, EDITOR, or VIEWER) with one or more IAM Identity Center identities.

---

Required: No  
Type: Array  
Update requires: No interruption

ServerUrl.description: The URL of the Argo CD server. Use this URL to access the Argo CD web interface and API.
ServerUrl.markdownDescription:
The URL of the Argo CD server. Use this URL to access the Argo CD web interface and API.

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Update requires: No interruption

ArgoCd.markdownDescription:
Configuration settings for an Argo CD capability. This includes the Kubernetes namespace, IAM Identity Center integration, RBAC role mappings, and network access configuration.

---

Required: No  
Update requires: No interruption

AwsIdc.description: Configuration for integrating Argo CD with IAM Identity Center. This allows you to use your organization's identity provider for authentication to Argo CD.

IdcInstanceArn.description: The ARN of the IAM Identity Center instance to use for authentication.
IdcInstanceArn.markdownDescription:
The ARN of the IAM Identity Center instance to use for authentication.

---

Required: Yes  
Type: String  
Update requires: No interruption

IdcRegion.description: The Region where your IAM Identity Center instance is located.
IdcRegion.markdownDescription:
The Region where your IAM Identity Center instance is located.

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Update requires: No interruption

IdcManagedApplicationArn.description: The ARN of the managed application created in IAM Identity Center for this Argo CD capability. This application is automatically created and managed by EKS.
IdcManagedApplicationArn.markdownDescription:
The ARN of the managed application created in IAM Identity Center for this Argo CD capability. This application is automatically created and managed by EKS.

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Update requires: No interruption

AwsIdc.markdownDescription:
Configuration for integrating Argo CD with IAM Identity Center. This allows you to use your organization's identity provider for authentication to Argo CD.

---

Required: No  
Update requires: No interruption

ArgoCdRoleMapping.description: A mapping between an Argo CD role and IAM Identity Center identities. This defines which users or groups have specific permissions in Argo CD.

Role.description: The Argo CD role to assign. Valid values are: ADMIN (full administrative access to Argo CD), EDITOR (edit access to Argo CD resources), or VIEWER (read-only access to Argo CD resources).
Role.markdownDescription:
The Argo CD role to assign. Valid values are: ADMIN (full administrative access to Argo CD), EDITOR (edit access to Argo CD resources), or VIEWER (read-only access to Argo CD resources).

---

Required: Yes  
Type: String  
Allowed Values: ADMIN | EDITOR | VIEWER  
Update requires: No interruption

Identities.description: A list of IAM Identity Center identities (users or groups) that should be assigned this Argo CD role.
Identities.markdownDescription:
A list of IAM Identity Center identities (users or groups) that should be assigned this Argo CD role.

---

Required: Yes  
Type: Array  
Update requires: No interruption

ArgoCdRoleMapping.markdownDescription:
A mapping between an Argo CD role and IAM Identity Center identities. This defines which users or groups have specific permissions in Argo CD.

---

Required: No  
Update requires: No interruption

SsoIdentity.description: An IAM Identity Center identity (user or group) that can be assigned permissions in a capability.

Id.description: The unique identifier of the IAM Identity Center user or group.
Id.markdownDescription:
The unique identifier of the IAM Identity Center user or group.

---

Required: Yes  
Type: String  
Update requires: No interruption

Type.description: The type of identity. Valid values are SSO_USER or SSO_GROUP.
Type.markdownDescription:
The type of identity. Valid values are SSO_USER or SSO_GROUP.

---

Required: Yes  
Type: String  
Allowed Values: SSO_USER | SSO_GROUP  
Update requires: No interruption

SsoIdentity.markdownDescription:
An IAM Identity Center identity (user or group) that can be assigned permissions in a capability.

---

Required: No  
Update requires: No interruption

NetworkAccess.description: Configuration for network access to the Argo CD capability's managed API server endpoint. By default, the Argo CD server is accessible via a public endpoint. You can optionally specify one or more VPC endpoint IDs to enable private connectivity from your VPCs.

VpceIds.description: A list of VPC endpoint IDs to associate with the managed Argo CD API server endpoint. Each VPC endpoint provides private connectivity from a specific VPC to the Argo CD server. You can specify multiple VPC endpoint IDs to enable access from multiple VPCs.

items.markdownDescription:
---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Update requires: No interruption

VpceIds.markdownDescription:
A list of VPC endpoint IDs to associate with the managed Argo CD API server endpoint. Each VPC endpoint provides private connectivity from a specific VPC to the Argo CD server. You can specify multiple VPC endpoint IDs to enable access from multiple VPCs.

---

Required: No  
Type: Array  
Update requires: No interruption

NetworkAccess.markdownDescription:
Configuration for network access to the Argo CD capability's managed API server endpoint. By default, the Argo CD server is accessible via a public endpoint. You can optionally specify one or more VPC endpoint IDs to enable private connectivity from your VPCs.

---

Required: No  
Update requires: No interruption

ClusterName.description: The name of the EKS cluster where you want to create the capability.
ClusterName.markdownDescription:
The name of the EKS cluster where you want to create the capability.

---

Required: Yes  
Type: String  
Minimum Length: 1  
Maximum Length: 100  
Update requires: Replacement

CapabilityName.description: A unique name for the capability. The name must be unique within your cluster and can contain alphanumeric characters, hyphens, and underscores.
CapabilityName.markdownDescription:
A unique name for the capability. The name must be unique within your cluster and can contain alphanumeric characters, hyphens, and underscores.

---

Required: Yes  
Type: String  
Minimum Length: 1  
Maximum Length: 100  
Update requires: Replacement

Type.description: The type of capability to create. Valid values are: ACK (AWS Controllers for Kubernetes, which lets you manage AWS resources directly from Kubernetes), ARGOCD (Argo CD for GitOps-based continuous delivery), or KRO (Kube Resource Orchestrator for composing and managing custom Kubernetes resources).
Type.markdownDescription:
The type of capability to create. Valid values are: ACK (AWS Controllers for Kubernetes, which lets you manage AWS resources directly from Kubernetes), ARGOCD (Argo CD for GitOps-based continuous delivery), or KRO (Kube Resource Orchestrator for composing and managing custom Kubernetes resources).

---

Required: Yes  
Type: String  
Allowed Values: ARGOCD | ACK | KRO  
Update requires: Replacement

RoleArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that the capability uses to interact with AWS services. This role must have a trust policy that allows the EKS service principal to assume it, and it must have the necessary permissions for the capability type you're creating.
RoleArn.markdownDescription:
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that the capability uses to interact with AWS services. This role must have a trust policy that allows the EKS service principal to assume it, and it must have the necessary permissions for the capability type you're creating.

---

Required: Yes  
Type: String  
Pattern: ^arn:aws[a-z-]*:iam::[0-9]+:role/[a-zA-Z0-9+=,.@_-]+$  
Update requires: No interruption

DeletePropagationPolicy.description: Specifies how Kubernetes resources managed by the capability should be handled when the capability is deleted. Currently, the only supported value is RETAIN which retains all Kubernetes resources managed by the capability when the capability is deleted.
DeletePropagationPolicy.markdownDescription:
Specifies how Kubernetes resources managed by the capability should be handled when the capability is deleted. Currently, the only supported value is RETAIN which retains all Kubernetes resources managed by the capability when the capability is deleted.

---

Required: Yes  
Type: String  
Allowed Values: RETAIN  
Update requires: No interruption

Configuration.description: The configuration settings for the capability. The structure of this object varies depending on the capability type. For Argo CD capabilities, you can configure IAM Identity Center integration, RBAC role mappings, and network access settings.
Configuration.markdownDescription:
The configuration settings for the capability. The structure of this object varies depending on the capability type. For Argo CD capabilities, you can configure IAM Identity Center integration, RBAC role mappings, and network access settings.

---

Required: No  
Type:   
Update requires: Replacement
Read only property: Yes

Arn.markdownDescription:
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the capability.

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Update requires: No interruption
Read only property: Yes

Status.description: The current status of the capability. Valid values include: CREATING (the capability is being created), ACTIVE (the capability is running and available), UPDATING (the capability is being updated), DELETING (the capability is being deleted), CREATE_FAILED (the capability creation failed), UPDATE_FAILED (the capability update failed), or DELETE_FAILED (the capability deletion failed).
Status.markdownDescription:
The current status of the capability. Valid values include: CREATING (the capability is being created), ACTIVE (the capability is running and available), UPDATING (the capability is being updated), DELETING (the capability is being deleted), CREATE_FAILED (the capability creation failed), UPDATE_FAILED (the capability update failed), or DELETE_FAILED (the capability deletion failed).

---

Required: No  
Type: String  
Update requires: No interruption
Read only property: Yes
